note: There is simultaneous brightening visible near S20W90 which may have contributed to this M1.0 flare observed primarily from Active Region 13738.

This flare occurred from a region near the eastern limb which was unnumbered and still rotating onto the Earth-facing disk. This flare occurred north of AR 3742, which was numbered on 2024-07-09, and may be associated with AR 3745, which was numbered on 2024-07-10.

This flare occurred from a region near the eastern limb which was unnumbered and still rotating onto the Earth-facing disk. AR 3742 was numbered on 2024-07-09 and is believed to be the source of this flare.

This flare occurred from a region near the eastern limb which was unnumbered and still rotating onto the Earth-facing disk. AR 3742 was numbered on 2024-07-09 and is believed to be the source of this flare.

This flare occurred from a region near the eastern limb which was unnumbered and still rotating onto the Earth-facing disk. AR 3742 was numbered on 2024-07-09 and is believed to be the source of this flare.

This flare occurred from a region near the eastern limb which was unnumbered and still rotating onto the Earth-facing disk. AR 3742 was numbered on 2024-07-09 and is believed to be the source of this flare.

GOES X-ray flux was previously elevated near M-class levels due to flaring activity from an unnumbered region near the southeast limb. The main contributor to this M1.0 flare was Active Region 13738, but it is possible there is minor contribution from the southeast unnumbered region as well.
This flare occurred from a region near the eastern limb which was at the moment unnumbered and still rotating onto the Earth-facing disk. AR 3742 was numbered on 2024-07-09.

This brightening spans over the Active Region, which extends from about S12E10 to S10E00 at the time of this flaring. The brightest portion is centered at about S09E04 at the peak time of this flaring.
There is also a slightly later M1.3 class flare from Active Region 3738.
Double peaked flare from AR 3738, with the second peak at 2024-07-11T04:32Z (with intensity of M1.2)
Double peaked flare from AR 3738, with the first peak at 2024-07-11T04:23Z(with intensity of M1.3)
The source is in the western part of Active Region 3738.
Simultaneous flaring from AR13745 and AR13738.
Impulsive flare.
Also there is a sympathetic eruption from the active region on the NE limb.
Some simultaneous eruptive brightening is seen from Active Region 13753 (N10W40) starting at 2024-07-17T06:46Z in SDO AIA 131, but this M5.0 flare is distinctly from Active Region 13743.
Simultaneous but lesser flaring from Active Region 13753 (N10W40).
This brightening is associated with both flaring activity and post-eruptive arcades from Active Region 13738 (S10W83). The flare source location has been updated based on NOAA/SWPC analysis.
First of a triple-peaked eruption from AR 3751. Second peak of M2.0 at 2024-07-18T10:27Z and a smaller third peak, not distinct in SDO AIA 131 from the other two, of M1.6 at 2024-07-18T10:40Z.
Second of a triple-peaked eruption from AR 3751. First peak of M2.2 at 2024-07-18T10:14Z and a smaller third peak, not distinct in SDO AIA 131 from the other two, of M1.6 at 2024-07-18T10:40Z.
This region was unnumbered at the time of the flare, but numbered later on 2024-07-23.
Simultaneous flaring from AR13762. This flare occurs during decay phase of the M3.1 flare from AR13762.
Flare end time adjusted due to simultaneous flaring (from AR13767) causing an increase in the GOES X-ray flux timeline (see M1.8 flare peaking at 2024-07-27T10:54Z).
Simultaneous flaring from AR13762. This flare occurs during decay phase of the M2.0 flare from AR13762.
Simultaneous flaring from AR13762.
Flare appears to occur between ARs 3766 and 3764 in available SDO AIA imagery.
This flare directly follows the M7.8 flare from the same region.
Sympathetic flare from AR 3762 (approx. S11W40) around the same time.
There may also be a sympathetic flare from AR 3768 peaking at 2024-07-29T01:36Z.
There is also a flare occurring from an unnumbered region on the SE limb at this time.
Active Region 13772, which is likely associated with this flare, was numbered after the flare was observed.
Active Region 13774, which is likely associated with this flare, was numbered after the flare was observed.
Simultaneous flaring from AR13765 (S12W03).
Simultaneous flaring from AR13762.
Simultaneous flaring observed with AR 3762.
Associated with simultaneous brightening at AR 3762, AR 3768, and an unnumbered region on the east limb around S05E90.
Flare occurring at the same time from AR 3762.
Some simultaneous brightening at S10W26 between AR 3767/3765.
